title: Navaratri special: Melon-orange-banana smoothie | Deccan Chronicle
text:
Deccan Chronicle | Priyadarshini Patwa | October 17, 2015, 15.58 pm IST Share Tweet Printer-friendly version Send by email Representative image Mumbai: The fifth day of Navaratri begins with us worshipping “Skanda Mata”. Seated on Lotus, she has serenity on her face and is accompanied by Lord Skanda in his infant form.
Often she is also called as the “Goddess of Fire”. This form of Durga is said to be the goddess of wisdom, power and prosperity.
While prosperity and happiness are making its way in your life, we have something to please your hunger pang. How about a glass of smoothie after your meal? We guarantee you it's as refreshing as it looks.
Recipe of the day: Melon-orange-banana smoothie
Representative image
Ingredient:
½ cup melon (chopped) 2 tbsp cup orange juice ½ banana (chopped) ¼ cup condensed milk 1 scoop Vanilla icecream ¾ crushed ice 1 tbsp honey Instruction:
Take a mixer jar and add chopped melon in it. Blend it till for 30 seconds.
Representative image
Add banana, crushed ice and condensed milk in the mixer and blend it again. Pour it in the glass and add orange juice it. Top it up with a scoop of vanilla icecream. Tip: Garnish it with honey
This recipe is a perfect pick if you are bored of eating same food during your fast and would like to savour something as delicious as this.
